name: drive
title: Drive API
description: Manages files in Drive including uploading, downloading, searching, detecting changes, and updating sharing permissions.

enumDescriptions: Responses with Content-Type of application/json

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: An opaque string that represents a user for quota purposes. Must not exceed 40 characters.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/activity.description: View the activity history of your Google apps

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.description: See, edit, create, and delete all of your Google Drive files

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.ac.description: View and add to the activity record of files in your Google Drive
View the activity record of files in your Google Drive

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.ap.description: View and manage its own configuration data in your Google Drive

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.fi.description: View and manage Google Drive files and folders that you have opened or created with this app

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.me.description: View and manage metadata of files in your Google Drive
View metadata for files in your Google Drive

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.ph.description: View the photos, videos and albums in your Google Photos

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.re.description: See and download all your Google Drive files

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.sc.description: Modify your Google Apps Script scripts' behavior

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.re.description: View your email messages and settings

About.description: An item with user information and settings.

additionalRoleInfo.description: Information about supported additional roles per file type. The most specific type takes precedence.

roleSets.description: The supported additional roles per primary role.

additionalRoles.description: The supported additional roles with the primary role.

type.description: The content type that this additional role info applies to.

canCreateDrives.description: Whether the user can create shared drives.

domain.description: The user's Apps domain, if applicable

domainSharingPolicy.description:
The domain sharing policy for the current user. Possible values are:  
- allowed 
- allowedWithWarning 
- incomingOnly 
- disallowed

driveThemes.description: A list of themes that are supported for shared drives.

backgroundImageLink.description: A link to this theme's background image.

colorRgb.description: The color of this theme as an RGB hex string.

source.description: The content type to convert from.

targets.description: The possible content types to convert to.

features.description: List of additional features enabled on this account.

featureRate.description: The request limit rate for this feature, in queries per second.

folderColorPalette.description: The palette of allowable folder colors as RGB hex strings.

source.description: The imported file's content type to convert from.

targets.description: The possible content types to convert to.

isCurrentAppInstalled.description: A boolean indicating whether the authenticated app is installed by the authenticated user.

languageCode.description: The user's language or locale code, as defined by BCP 47, with some extensions from Unicode's LDML format (http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/).

maxUploadSizes.description: List of max upload sizes for each file type. The most specific type takes precedence.

size.description: The max upload size for this type.

name.description: The name of the current user.

permissionId.description: The current user's ID as visible in the permissions collection.

photosServiceEnabled.description: Whether the Google Photos service is enabled for this account.

quotaBytesByService.description: The amount of storage quota used by different Google services.

bytesUsed.description: The storage quota bytes used by the service.

serviceName.description: The service's name, e.g. DRIVE, GMAIL, or PHOTOS.

quotaBytesTotal.description: The total number of quota bytes.

quotaBytesUsed.description: The number of quota bytes used by Google Drive.

quotaBytesUsedAggregate.description: The number of quota bytes used by all Google apps (Drive, Picasa, etc.).

quotaBytesUsedInTrash.description: The number of quota bytes used by trashed items.

quotaType.description:
The type of the user's storage quota. Possible values are:  
- LIMITED 
- UNLIMITED

remainingChangeIds.description: The number of remaining change ids, limited to no more than 2500.

rootFolderId.description: The id of the root folder.

selfLink.description: A link back to this item.

ActionItem.description: An action item (TODO) on the file for user. Action item currently can be an unanswered mentions or an unresolved suggestions, but can be extended to other types like unseen edits, due tasks on files, etc. Any metadata associated with action item will also be included here. Details in http://go/docos-handling-priority-docs

id.description: The ID of action item. E.g. comment ID of an unanswered mention in Kix document.

type.description: The type of action item. Type can be MENTION and SUGGESTION.

AdminFile.description: An admin's view of a file, used in admin requests.

driveId.description: ID of the shared drive the file resides in.

App.description: The apps resource provides a list of the apps that a user has installed, with information about each app's supported MIME types, file extensions, and other details.

appDataQuotaBytesUsed.description: The amount of Application Data quota used, in bytes. May be 0 while still having Application Data.

authorized.description: Whether the app is authorized to access data on the user's Drive.

chromeExtensionIds.description: The list of Chrome extension IDs associated with the app.

createInFolderTemplate.description: The template url to create a new file with this app in a given folder. The template will contain {folderId} to be replaced by the folder to create the new file in.

createUrl.description: The url to create a new file with this app.

driveBranded.description: Whether the app is an official Google Drive branded app.

driveSource.description: Whether the app has created items in the user's Drive.

hasAppData.description: Whether the app has Application Data.

hasDriveWideScope.description: Whether the app has drive-wide scope. An app with drive-wide scope can access all files in the user's drive.

hasGsmListing.description: Whether the app has a G-Suite Marketplace (GSM) listing.

hidden.description: Whether the app is normally supressed from the list of apps.

icons.description: The various icons for the app.

category.description:
Category of the icon. Allowed values are:  
- application - icon for the application 
- document - icon for a file associated with the app 
- documentShared - icon for a shared file associated with the app

size.description: Size of the icon. Represented as the maximum of the width and height.

longDescription.description: A long description of the app.

objectType.description: The type of object this app creates (e.g. Chart). If empty, the app name should be used instead.

openUrlTemplate.description: The template url for opening files with this app. The template will contain {ids} and/or {exportIds} to be replaced by the actual file ids.

origins.description: The list of origins from which this app can be served.

primaryFileExtensions.description: The list of primary file extensions.

primaryMimeTypes.description: The list of primary mime types.

productId.description: The ID of the product listing for this app.

productUrl.description: A link to the product listing for this app.

rankingInfo.description: Information used to rank this app's quality versus other apps.

score.description: A numeric score for this app for opening this file type.
A numeric score for this app for opening this file type.

removable.description: Whether the app is removable (also known as uninstallable or deletable). Domain-installed apps and some first-party apps are "force installed" and therefore cannot be uninstalled by clients.

requiresAuthorizationBeforeOpenWith.description: Whether the app must be authorized before an "Open with" operation can be performed.

secondaryFileExtensions.description: The list of secondary file extensions.

secondaryMimeTypes.description: The list of secondary mime types.

shortDescription.description: A short description of the app.

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the app supports both My Drives and shared drives.

supportsCreate.description: Whether this app supports creating new objects.

supportsImport.description: Whether this app supports importing Google Docs.

supportsMobileBrowser.description: Whether this app has indicated it works in mobile browsers.

supportsMultiOpen.description: Whether this app supports opening more than one file.

supportsOfflineCreate.description: Whether this app supports creating new files when offline.

useByDefault.description: Whether the app is selected as the default handler for the types it supports.

AppList.description: A list of third-party applications which the user has installed or given access to Google Drive.

defaultAppIds.description: List of app IDs that the user has specified to use by default. The list is in reverse-priority order (lowest to highest).

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

capabilities.description: Set of actions that the user may take on the Approval.

canAddReviewers.description: Whether the current user can add reviewers to the Approval.

canCancel.description: Whether the current user can cancel the Approval.

canComment.description: Whether the current user can add a comment to the Approval.

canModifyDueDate.description: Whether the current user can modify the due date of the Approval.

canReview.description: Whether the current user can review the Approval.

commentText.description: The initial comment for the Approval. This is a write-only field; it can only be set when inserting an Approval.

completedDate.description: The time at which this Approval was completed (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

createdDate.description: The time at which this Approval was created (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

dueDate.description: The due date for this Approval (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This field can be set when inserting an Approval. Due date of an existing approval can be modified with a drive.approvals.setDueDate request.

initiator.description: The user that requested the Approval.

latest.description: Whether revisionId is the Drive item's most current revision.

modifiedDate.description: The time at which this Approval was modified (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

reviewerDecisions.description: The decisions that are part of the Approval.

reviewerEmailAddresses.description: Specify the reviewers for the Approval. This is a write-only field; it can only be set when inserting an Approval.

revisionId.description: Revision of the Drive item at which the Approval was initiated.

commentText.description: The text of a comment to add to the Approval, if desired.

ApprovalDecisionRequest.description: A request to make a decision on an Approval.

commentText.description: The text of a comment to add to the Approval, if desired.

decision.description:
The decision being made by the requester. Supported values include:  
- approved 
- declined

approvalCompleteEvent.description: The Approval is complete. This can occur when all reviewers have approved the Approval, any one reviewer has declined the Approval, or when an editor performs a drive.approvals.cancel action.

commentText.description: Comment on the Approval's completion, if any.

status.description: The completed status of the Approval.

commentText.description: Initial comment by the Approval creator, if any.

dueDate.description: Initial due date set by the Approval creator, if any.

reviewers.description: The initial reviewers added to the Approval.

commentEvent.description: Someone has commented on the Approval. This event is created when someone performs a drive.approvals.comment action.

commentText.description: The comment on the Approval. This must be present.

createdDate.description: The time at which this ApprovalEvent was created (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

decisionEvent.description: A reviewer has made a decision on the Approval. This event is created when a reviewer performs a drive.approvals.approve action.

commentText.description: Reviewer's comment on the decision, if any.

dueDate.description: The due date set on the Approval. Empty if the due date was cleared.

priorDueDate.description: The due date of the Approval prior to this due date change event.

reviewerChangeEvent.description: Someone has changed the reviewers on the Approval. This event is created when someone performs a drive.approvals.changeReviewers action.

addedReviewers.description: The reviewers added to the Approval.

commentText.description: Comment on the reviewer change, if any.

reassignedReviewers.description: The reassignments made to the Approval reviewers.

items.description: The list of ApprovalEvents. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of ApprovalEvents. This will be absent if the end of the ApprovalEvents list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

ApprovalEventRequest.description: A request to cancel or comment on an Approval.

commentText.description: The text of a comment to add to the Approval, if desired.

items.description: The list of Approvals. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of Approvals. This will be absent if the end of the Approvals list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

ApprovalSummary.description: A summary of a single approval associated with an item.

approvalId.description: The ID of the approval referenced by this summary.

status.description: The status of the approval. Possible status values are: IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETED, and CANCELLED.

ArchiveExtractionJob.description: Represents metadata and status of an archive file extraction job.

destinationLocationId.description: The ID of the folder to extract the contents of the archive into.

etag.description: The ETag of the file preview.

id.description: The ID for this archive file extraction job.

sourceFileId.description: The ID for the archive file that is extracted.

status.description:
The current status of this file extraction job. Values are one of:  
- INITIATED 
- PREPARED 
- SUCCEEDED 
- PENDING_ROLLBACK 
- FAILED

ArchiveResourcePreview.description: A preview for a file resource within an archive.

children.description: The list of child resource previews of this preview.

errorType.description:
The type of error associated with this resource. Allowed values are:  
- NONE 
- RESOURCE_UNREADABLE 
- RESOURCE_TOO_LARGE 
- USER_LACKS_QUOTA

mimeType.description: The mime type of the resource within the archive file.

path.description: The path of the resource within the archive file.

Attachment.description: Representation of a gmail attachment metadata.

fileId.description: The ID of the file created in Drive.

messageId.description: The message ID of the attachment. This is expected to be a hex string.

partId.description: The part ID of the attachment.

backupSource.description: The source of the backup. Possible values are: whatsapp and carbon.

backupSummary.description: A summary of the contents of this backup. A map of types to the number and total size of the files of that type.

externalId.description: The user-facing identifier for this backup. For WhatsApp backups, this is the phone number of the WhatsApp account.

extractionState.description:
The current state of extraction for this backup. Extraction state can only be modified by calling startExtraction and stopExtraction. Transitions to ongoing and failed states are triggered by the completion or failure of processing in the backend.
Possible values are:  
- notStarted the user hasn't started extraction 
- started the user started extraction, but the initial extraction isn't complete 
- ongoing the initial extraction has completed and ongoing extraction is enabled 
- stopped the user paused the extraction from either the started or ongoing state 
- failed there was a persistent failure in either the initial or ongoing extraction

targetFolderId.description: The ID of the target folder for the extraction of this backup.

BackupList.description: A list of backups for a user.

CategoryAttributeValue.description: Representation of a Category Attribute Value.

boolean.description: Only present if valueType is boolean.

dateString.description: Only present if valueType is dateString. RFC 3339 formatted date: YYYY-MM-DD.

driveFile.description: Only present if valueType is driveFile.

driveFileList.description: Only present if valueType is driveFileList.

id.description: The identifier of this Category Attribute Value.

integer.description: Only present if valueType is integer.

integerList.description: Only present if valueType is integerList.

longText.description: Only present if valueType is longText.

money.description: Only present if valueType is money.

moneyList.description: Only present if valueType is moneyList.

selection.description: Only present if valueType is selection.

selectionList.description: Only present if valueType is selectionList

text.description: Only present if valueType is text.

textList.description: Only present if valueType is textList.

user.description: Only present if valueType is user.

userList.description: Only present if valueType is userList.

userScoped.description: Only present if valueType is userScoped.

valueType.description:
The attribute type. While new values may be supported in the future, the following are currently allowed:  
- boolean 
- dateString 
- driveFile 
- driveFileList 
- integer 
- integerList 
- longText 
- money 
- moneyList 
- selection 
- selectionList 
- text 
- textList 
- user 
- userList 
- userScoped

CategoryAttributeValueDelta.description: Representation of a Category Attribute Value being modified.

addIntegerValues.description: A new value to add to a list of integer values if the attribute is an integer list attribute.

addSelectionValues.description: A new value to add to a list of selection values if the attribute is a selection multi select attribute.

addTextValues.description: A new value to add to a list of text values if the attribute is a text list attribute.

addUserValues.description: Add new values to a list of users if the attribute is a user list attribute. The values must be valid email addresses.

id.description: The identifier of the Attribute Value to be modified.

setBooleanValue.description: The new value if the attribute is a boolean attribute.

setDateStringValue.description: The new value if the attribute is a dateString attribute. The string must be in the RFC 3339 full-date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

setIntegerValue.description: The new value if the attribute is an integer attribute.

setIntegerValues.description: Replaces the list of integer values with these new values if the attribute is an integer list attribute.

setLongTextValue.description: The new value if the attribute is a long text attribute.

setSelectionValue.description: The new value if the attribute is a selection single select attribute.

setSelectionValues.description: Replaces the list of selection values with these new values if the attribute is a selection multi select attribute.

setTextValue.description: The new value if the attribute is a text attribute.

setTextValues.description: Replaces the list of text values with these new values if the attribute is a text list attribute.

setUserValue.description: The new value if the attribute is a user attribute. The value must be a valid email address.

setUserValues.description: Replaces the list of users if the attribute is a user list attribute. The values must be valid email addresses.

CategoryMetadata.description: Representation of Category and Attribute Metadata.

attributeValues.description: The values of the Category Metadata Attributes for the file. This is a map of Attribute metadata keyed by the Attribute id.

CategoryMetadataDelta.description: Representation of an update to Category Metadata.

categoryAttributeValueDeltas.description: The category metadata attributes to update.

categoryName.description: The name of the Category to which the update applies.

revertAttributeIds.description: The category metadata attributes to revert to their default value.

CategoryMetadataList.description: A map of Category names to Category Metadata.

categoryMetadata.description: A map of the name of the Category to the Category Metadata applied to this item. DEPRECATED - use 'items' instead. This field will be deleted and will not be copied into v2 or v3. TODO(b/117280829) - remove this field once it is not used by internal clients.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of Category Metadata. This field will be absent if the end of the list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

Change.description: Representation of a change to a file or shared drive.

changeType.description: The type of the change. Possible values are file and drive.

deleted.description: Whether the file or shared drive has been removed from this list of changes, for example by deletion or loss of access.

drive.description: The updated state of the shared drive. Present if the changeType is drive, the user is still a member of the shared drive, and the shared drive has not been deleted.

driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive associated with this change.

file.description: The updated state of the file. Present if the type is file and the file has not been removed from this list of changes.

fileId.description: The ID of the file associated with this change.

fileVersion.description: The version of the file associated with this change. See file.version.

selfLink.description: A link back to this change.

ChangeList.description: A list of changes for a user.

items.description: The list of changes. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

largestChangeId.description: Deprecated - use changes.getStartPageToken or newStartPageToken instead.

newStartPageToken.description: The starting page token for future changes. This will be present only if the end of the current changes list has been reached.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of changes.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of changes. This will be absent if the end of the changes list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

Channel.description: An notification channel used to watch for resource changes.

address.description: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel.

expiration.description: Date and time of notification channel expiration, expressed as a Unix timestamp, in milliseconds. Optional.

id.description: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel.

kind.description: Identifies this as a notification channel used to watch for changes to a resource, which is "api#channel".

params.description: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior. Optional.

additionalProperties.description: Declares a new parameter by name.

payload.description: A Boolean value to indicate whether payload is wanted. Optional.

resourceId.description: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

resourceUri.description: A version-specific identifier for the watched resource.

token.description: An arbitrary string delivered to the target address with each notification delivered over this channel. Optional.

type.description: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel.

fileIds.description: List of files by ID to check access to for the specified email addresses and role.

recipientEmailAddresses.description: List of email addresses to ensure access for the specified items and role.

fixOptions.description: A list of proposed permission fixes for the specified recipients and files.

addCollaboratorsInfo.description: If 'option_type' is set to 'ADD_COLLABORATORS', contains relevant information about adding collaborators.

outOfDomainWarningEmailAddresses.description: List of recipient email addresses for which an out-of-domain-sharing warning must be shown, stating that these email addresses are not in at least one of the Google Apps organizations that the requested items belong to.

allowedRoles.description: Roles which may be offered to the user to select from.

fixableFileIds.description: The file ids this fix applies to. These are the items which will need their ACLs changed. It is not the list of items which will be readable by the recipient after the fix is applied, which may be larger.

fixableRecipientEmailAddresses.description: The recipients whose access to some/all of the items will change as a result of the fix.

fixesEverything.description: If true, then this option fixes access to all recipients for all files. Otherwise, the option only fixes access for either some recipients or some files.

increaseDomainVisibilityInfo.description: If 'optionType' is set to 'INCREASE_DOMAIN_VISIBILITY', contains relevant information about increasing domain visibility.

domainDisplayName.description: The name to be displayed to the user for the domain to which this domain visibility fix applies. For example "Google.com" (in the case of "google.com". Note the difference in capitalization).

domainName.description: The raw domain name for the domain to which this domain visibility fix applies. For example "google.com".

optionType.description: The broad class of fix being proposed.

fixabilitySummaryState.description: A summary of the overall fixability of the proposed recipients and files.

ChildList.description: A list of children of a file.

items.description: The list of children. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of children.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of children. This will be absent if the end of the children list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

ChildReference.description: A reference to a folder's child.

selfLink.description: A link back to this reference.

Comment.description: A comment on a file in Google Drive.

anchor.description: A region of the document represented as a JSON string. See anchor documentation for details on how to define and interpret anchor properties.

author.description: The user who wrote this comment.

content.description: The plain text content used to create this comment. This is not HTML safe and should only be used as a starting point to make edits to a comment's content.

context.description: The context of the file which is being commented on.

type.description: The MIME type of the context snippet.

value.description: Data representation of the segment of the file being commented on. In the case of a text file for example, this would be the actual text that the comment is about.

createdDate.description: The date when this comment was first created.

deleted.description: Whether this comment has been deleted. If a comment has been deleted the content will be cleared and this will only represent a comment that once existed.

fileId.description: The file which this comment is addressing.

fileTitle.description: The title of the file which this comment is addressing.

htmlContent.description: HTML formatted content for this comment.

modifiedDate.description: The date when this comment or any of its replies were last modified.

selfLink.description: A link back to this comment.

status.description:
The status of this comment. Status can be changed by posting a reply to a comment with the desired status.  
- "open" - The comment is still open. 
- "resolved" - The comment has been resolved by one of its replies.

suggestionId.description: Suggestion ID if the post is a suggestion, empty otherwise.

CommentList.description: A list of comments on a file in Google Drive.

items.description: The list of comments. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of comments.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of comments. This will be absent if the end of the comments list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

CommentReply.description: A reply to a comment on a file in Google Drive.

author.description: The user who wrote this reply.

content.description: The plain text content used to create this reply. This is not HTML safe and should only be used as a starting point to make edits to a reply's content. This field is required on inserts if no verb is specified (resolve/reopen).

createdDate.description: The date when this reply was first created.

deleted.description: Whether this reply has been deleted. If a reply has been deleted the content will be cleared and this will only represent a reply that once existed.

htmlContent.description: HTML formatted content for this reply.

modifiedDate.description: The date when this reply was last modified.

verb.description:
The action this reply performed to the parent comment. When creating a new reply this is the action to be perform to the parent comment. Possible values are:  
- "resolve" - To resolve a comment. 
- "reopen" - To reopen (un-resolve) a comment.

CommentReplyList.description: A list of replies to a comment on a file in Google Drive.

items.description: The list of replies. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of replies.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of replies. This will be absent if the end of the replies list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

ContentRestriction.description: A restriction for accessing the content of the file.

readOnly.description: Whether the content of the file is read-only.

reason.description: Reason for why the content of the file is restricted. This is only mutable on requests that also set readOnly=true.

restrictingUser.description: The user who set the content restriction. Only populated if readOnly is true.

restrictionDate.description: The time at which the content restriction was set (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Only populated if readOnly is true.

type.description: The type of the content restriction. Currently the only possible value is globalContentRestriction.

Date.description: Representation of a Date containing a year, month, and day.

day.description: The date's day. Valid values are 1 - 31, depending on the month.

month.description: The date's month. Valid values are 1 - 12.

backgroundImageFile.description: An image file and cropping parameters from which a background image for this shared drive is set. This is a write only field; it can only be set on drive.drives.update requests that don't set themeId. When specified, all fields of the backgroundImageFile must be set.

id.description: The ID of an image file in Google Drive to use for the background image.

width.description: The width of the cropped image in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the width of the cropped image divided by the width of the entire image. The height is computed by applying a width to height aspect ratio of 80 to 9. The resulting image must be at least 1280 pixels wide and 144 pixels high.

xCoordinate.description: The X coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the horizontal distance from the left side of the entire image to the left side of the cropping area divided by the width of the entire image.

yCoordinate.description: The Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the cropping area in the background image. This is a value in the closed range of 0 to 1. This value represents the vertical distance from the top side of the entire image to the top side of the cropping area divided by the height of the entire image.

backgroundImageGridViewLink.description: A link to this shared drive's background image for use in Tesla's grid view.

backgroundImageLink.description: A short-lived link to this shared drive's background image.

backgroundImageListViewLink.description: A link to this shared drive's background image for use in Tesla's list view.

capabilities.description: Capabilities the current user has on this shared drive.

canAddChildren.description: Whether the current user can add children to folders in this shared drive.

canChangeCategoryReferences.description: Whether the current user can change references to categories on this shared drive.

canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermissionRes.description: Whether the current user can change the copyRequiresWriterPermission restriction of this shared drive.

canChangeDisallowDriveFileStreamRestrict.description: Whether the current user can change the disallowDriveFileStream restriction of this shared drive.

canChangeDomainUsersOnlyRestriction.description: Whether the current user can change the domainUsersOnly restriction of this shared drive.

canChangeDriveBackground.description: Whether the current user can change the background of this shared drive.

canChangeDriveMembersOnlyRestriction.description: Whether the current user can change the driveMembersOnly restriction of this shared drive.

canComment.description: Whether the current user can comment on files in this shared drive.

canCopy.description: Whether the current user can copy files in this shared drive.

canDeleteChildren.description: Whether the current user can delete children from folders in this shared drive.

canDeleteDrive.description: Whether the current user can delete this shared drive. Attempting to delete the shared drive may still fail if there are untrashed items inside the shared drive.

canDownload.description: Whether the current user can download files in this shared drive.

canEdit.description: Whether the current user can edit files in this shared drive.

canListChildren.description: Whether the current user can list the children of folders in this shared drive.

canManageMembers.description: Whether the current user can add members to this shared drive or remove them or change their role.

canPrint.description: Whether files in this shared drive can be printed by the current user.

canReadRevisions.description: Whether the current user can read the revisions resource of files in this shared drive.

canRename.description: Whether the current user can rename files or folders in this shared drive.

canRenameDrive.description: Whether the current user can rename this shared drive.

canShare.description: Whether the current user can share files or folders in this shared drive.

canShareToAllUsers.description: Whether the current user can share files or folders in this shared drive to all users, including those who are not signed in.

canTrashChildren.description: Whether the current user can trash children from folders in this shared drive.

colorRgb.description: The color of this shared drive as an RGB hex string. It can only be set on a drive.drives.update request that does not set themeId.

createdDate.description: The time at which the shared drive was created (RFC 3339 date-time).

creator.description: User that created the shared drive, if available. Only returned when useDomainAdminAccess=true.

hidden.description: Whether the shared drive is hidden from default view.

id.description: The ID of this shared drive which is also the ID of the top level folder of this shared drive.

name.description: The name of this shared drive.

organizationDisplayName.description: The display name of the organization to which this shared drive belongs.

permissionsSummary.description: A summary of the permissions of this shared drive as an output-only field.

entryCount.description: Total number of permission entries. This includes entries not in "selectPermissions".

groupEntryCount.description: Total number of group type permission entries. This includes entries not in "selectPermissions".

memberCount.description: Total number of members of this shared drive, which contains the expanded group membership counts for any groups. If the shared drive has several members a lower bound is returned instead.

selectPermissions.description: A selection of at most 10 entries from the shared drive's permissions.

userEntryCount.description: Total number of user type permission entries. This includes entries not in "selectPermissions".

primaryDomainName.description: The DNS domain name of the primary domain of the organization to which this shared drive belongs.

recursiveFileCount.description: The number of files contained within this shared drive, excluding the shared drive's top level folder. NOTE: this value is stale, and is only intended to be used by Cello for backfilling purposes. Do not add to public API versions. More info: go/team-drive-stats-api

recursiveFolderCount.description: The number of folders contained within this shared drive, excluding the shared drive's top level folder. NOTE: this value is stale, and is only intended to be used by Cello for backfilling purposes. Do not add to public API versions. More info: go/team-drive-stats-api

restrictions.description: A set of restrictions that apply to this shared drive or items inside this shared drive.

adminManagedRestrictions.description: Whether administrative privileges on this shared drive are required to modify restrictions.

copyRequiresWriterPermission.description: Whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this shared drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters. When this restriction is set to true, it will override the similarly named field to true for any file inside this shared drive.

disallowDriveFileStream.description: Whether Drive File Stream is prevented from accessing items inside this shared drive.

domainUsersOnly.description: Whether access to this shared drive and items inside this shared drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this shared drive belongs. This restriction may be overridden by other sharing policies controlled outside of this shared drive.

driveMembersOnly.description: Whether access to items inside this shared drive is restricted to its members.

restrictionsOverride.description: A set of overrides for any restriction that can be overridden outside of the shared drive's restriction settings. The name of the override is identical to the name of the restriction which can be overridden.

domainUsersOnly.description: The override status for the domainUsersOnly restriction. Possible values are notOverridden and overriddenToTrue.

themeId.description: The ID of the theme from which the background image and color will be set. The set of possible driveThemes can be retrieved from a drive.about.get response. When not specified on a drive.drives.insert request, a random theme is chosen from which the background image and color are set. This is a write-only field; it can only be set on requests that don't set colorRgb or backgroundImageFile.

trusted.description: Whether this shared drive belongs to a domain that is trusted by the requesting user's domain.

DriveCategoryChangeRequest.description: A request to add/remove references to categories on a shared drive.

addCategoryReferences.description: The references to categories to add or update on the shared drive.

removeCategoryReferences.description: The category resource names to remove from the shared drive.

items.description: The list of shared drives. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of shared drives. This will be absent if the end of the list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

Efficiency.description: Information regarding what aspects of a request impacted efficiency.

inefficientDriveServiceFields.description: The inefficient Drive Service fields requested.

queryStrategies.description: The Drive Service query strategies used to answer the request.

actionItems.description: Action items for the current user on this file.

alternateLink.description: A link for opening the file in a relevant Google editor or viewer.

alwaysShowInPhotos.description: If set, this item will be sync'd to Photos with a flag indicating it should always be shown even if Google Drive objects are filtered out. This is intended for use only by the Google Drive/Photos unified uploader, and will be enforced by a whitelist.

appDataContents.description: Whether this file is in the appdata folder.

appliedCategories.description: Names of categories that have been applied to the file.

approvalMetadata.description: Metadata regarding Approvals associated with this file.

approvalSummaries.description: Summaries of all approvals associated with this item.

approvalVersion.description: The overall version of all approvals associated with this file (incremented on each approval write).

authorizedAppIds.description: The apps that are authorized to this file. This is only populated when the drive.apps scope is used.

blockingDetectors.description: A list of DLP detector names for the file with blocking consequences.

capabilities.description: Capabilities the current user has on this file. Each capability corresponds to a fine-grained action that a user may take.

canAddChildren.description: Whether the current user can add children to this folder. This is always false when the item is not a folder.

canAddMyDriveParent.description: Whether the current user can add a parent for the item without removing an existing parent in the same request. Not populated for shared drive files.

canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermission.description: Whether the current user can change the copyRequiresWriterPermission restriction of this file.

canChangePermissionExpiration.description: Whether the current user can add or change a permission's expiration date on this file.

canChangeWritersCanShare.description: Whether the current user can change whether users with writer permission can share this file.

canComment.description: Whether the current user can comment on this file.

canCopy.description: Whether the current user can copy this file. For a shared drive item, whether the current user can copy non-folder descendants of this item, or this item itself if it is not a folder.

canDelete.description: Whether the current user can delete this file.

canDeleteChildren.description: Whether the current user can delete children of this folder. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for shared drive items.

canDownload.description: Whether the current user can download this file.

canEdit.description: Whether the current user can edit this file. Other factors may limit the type of changes a user can make to a file. For example, see canChangeCopyRequiresWriterPermission or canModifyContent.

canEditCategoryMetadata.description: Whether the current user can edit the category metadata on this file.

canListChildren.description: Whether the current user can list the children of this folder. This is always false when the item is not a folder.

canModifyContent.description: Whether the current user can modify the content of this file.

canModifyContentRestriction.description: Whether the current user can modify restrictions on content of this file.

canMoveChildrenOutOfDrive.description: Whether the current user can move children of this folder outside of the shared drive. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for items in shared drives.

canMoveChildrenWithinDrive.description: Whether the current user can move children of this folder within the shared drive. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for items in shared drives.

canMoveItemOutOfDrive.description: Whether the current user can move this item outside of this drive by changing its parent. Note that a request to change the parent of the item may still fail depending on the new parent that is being added.

canMoveItemWithinDrive.description: Whether the current user can move this item within this drive. Note that a request to change the parent of the item may still fail depending on the new parent that is being added.

canMoveTeamDriveItem.description: Deprecated - use canMoveItemWithinDrive or canMoveItemOutOfDrive instead.

canPrint.description: Whether the current user can print this file.

canRead.description: Whether the current user can read this file.

canReadAllPermissions.description: Whether the current user can read all the permissions on this file.

canReadCategoryMetadata.description: Whether the current user can read the category metadata on this file.

canReadDrive.description: Whether the current user can read the shared drive to which this file belongs. Only populated for items in shared drives.

canReadRevisions.description: Whether the current user can read the revisions resource of this file. For a shared drive item, whether revisions of non-folder descendants of this item, or this item itself if it is not a folder, can be read.

canRemoveChildren.description: Whether the current user can remove children from this folder. This is always false when the item is not a folder. For shared drive items, use canDeleteChildren or canTrashChildren instead.

canRemoveMyDriveParent.description: Whether the current user can remove a parent from the item without adding another parent in the same request. Not populated for shared drive files.

canRename.description: Whether the current user can rename this file.

canRequestApproval.description: Whether the current user can request an approval on this file.

canShare.description: Whether the current user can modify the sharing settings for this file.

canShareAsCommenter.description: Whether the current user can share this file with the commenter role. Only populated for shared drive items.

canShareAsFileOrganizer.description: Whether the current user can share this file with the fileOrganizer role. Only populated for shared drive items.

canShareAsOrganizer.description: Whether the current user can share this file with the organizer role. Only populated for shared drive items.

canShareAsOwner.description: Whether the current user can share this file with the owner role. Only populated for shared drive items.

canShareAsReader.description: Whether the current user can share this file with the reader role. Only populated for shared drive items.

canShareAsWriter.description: Whether the current user can share this file with the writer role. Only populated for shared drive items.

canSharePublishedViewAsReader.description: Whether the current user can share the published view of this file with the reader role.

canShareToAllUsers.description: Whether the current user can share this file with all users, including those who are not signed in.

canTrash.description: Whether the current user can move this file to trash.

canTrashChildren.description: Whether the current user can trash children of this folder. This is false when the item is not a folder. Only populated for shared drive items.

canUntrash.description: Whether the current user can restore this file from trash.

categoryMetadata.description: Category Metadata that have been applied to the file, keyed by the category name. To include Category Metadata on a file, both this field must be requested, and the categoryMetadataNames query param must be populated with the desired Category Metadata to include. For example: categoryMetadataNames='category_1,category_5', fields='categoryMetadata'

changed.description: Deprecated: value is no longer being written on updates and cannot be trusted. This used to return whether this file has been changed since this user last viewed it.

clientEncryptionDetails.description: Client Side Encryption related details. Contains details about the encryption state of the file and details regarding the encryption mechanism that clients need to use when decrypting the contents of this item. This will only be present on files and not on folders or shortcuts.

encryptionState.description:
The encryption state of the file. The values expected here are:  
- encrypted 
- unencrypted

commentsImported.description: Whether the comments import has finished for the head revision.

containsUnsubscribedChildren.description: Whether this folder contains children that are unsubscribed.

readOnly.description: Whether the content of the file is read-only.

reason.description: Reason for why the content of the file is restricted. This is only mutable on requests that also set readOnly=true.

contentRestrictions.description: Restrictions for accessing the content of the file. Only populated if such a restriction exists.

copyRequiresWriterPermission.description: Whether the options to copy, print, or download this file, should be disabled for readers and commenters.

createdDate.description: The time at which this file was created, possibly as specified by the uploading client (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

creator.description: User that created the item, if available.

creatorAppId.description: The ID of the application that was used to create this file.

defaultOpenWithLink.description: A link to open this file with the user's default app for this file. Only populated when the drive.apps[.readonly] scope is used.

descendantOfRoot.description: Whether the file is parented under root or any of its subfolders. Note that this field is not completely reliable as there can be propagation delays. Not populated for shared drive files.

description.description: A short description of the file.

detectors.description: A list of DLP detector names for the file. These detectors have consequence, for example blocking sharing. DLP detectors without consequences will not appear in this list. Consider using blockingDetectors and warningDetectors instead if the type of consequence is important.

driveId.description: ID of the shared drive the file resides in. Only populated for items in shared drives.

driveSource.description: The client that created an item.

clientServiceId.description: The unique identifier for the client, limited to the values in DriveSource.ClientService

value.description: An optional value carrying extra information about the client.

embedLink.description: A link for embedding the file.

embedded.description: Whether this file is embedded within a package. Applications must be whitelisted to read this field.

embeddingParent.description: On write, the ID of the embedding parent file in which to embed this file. If the parent file belongs to a package the file is added to the same package, otherwise a new package is created with the ID of the parent file. On Read, the file ID of the embedding parent of this file within a package. Only present if the file is embedded in a package. Applications must be whitelisted to write or read this field.

explicitlyTrashed.description: Whether this file has been explicitly trashed, as opposed to recursively trashed.

exportLinks.description: Links for exporting Google Docs to specific formats.

additionalProperties.description: A mapping from export format to URL

fileExtension.description: The final component of fullFileExtension with trailing text that does not appear to be part of the extension removed. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Google Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

fileSize.description: The size of the file in bytes. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Google Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

flaggedForAbuse.description: Whether the file is flagged for abuse.

folderColor.description: Folder color (palette index) if the file is a folder. Not populated for shared drive files.

folderColorRgb.description: Folder color as an RGB hex string if the file is a folder. The list of supported colors is available in the folderColorPalette field of the About resource. If an unsupported color is specified, it will be changed to the closest color in the palette. Not populated for shared drive files.

folderFeatures.description: Additional attributes for a folder. DEPRECATED: use folderProperties instead

externalMedia.description: This is a external media folder.

machineRoot.description: This is a root directory of a machine sync.

photosAndVideosOnly.description: This is a photo and video only folder.

psynchoFolder.description: This folder is part of the user's Pyncho directory, but not the root.

psynchoRoot.description: This folder is the user's Pyncho root directory.

fullFileExtension.description: The full file extension; extracted from the title. May contain multiple concatenated extensions, such as "tar.gz". Removing an extension from the title does not clear this field; however, changing the extension on the title does update this field. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Google Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

gplusMedia.description: Whether this file is a Google+ photo or video. Deleting such a file also deletes it from Google+.

hasAppsScriptAddOn.description: Whether the file has an Apps Script add-on attached.

hasAugmentedPermissions.description: Whether any users are granted file access directly on this file. This field is only populated for shared drive files.

hasChildFolders.description: Whether the folder has one or more child folders.

hasComment.description: Whether the file has a comment.

hasLegacyBlobComments.description: Whether the file has legacy blob comments.

hasPermissionsForViews.description: Whether the file has permissions for a view.

hasPreventDownloadConsequence.description: Whether a DLP detector exists with a restrict download consequence.

hasThumbnail.description: Whether this file has a thumbnail. This does not indicate whether the requesting app has access to the thumbnail. To check access, look for the presence of the thumbnailLink field.

hasVisitorPermissions.description: Whether there is a visitor entry on this file for any user. This field is only populated for shared drive files.

headRevisionCreationDate.description: The creation date of the file's head revision (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This will only be populated for files with content stored in Google Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

headRevisionId.description: The ID of the file's head revision. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Google Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

iconLink.description: A link to the file's icon.

imageMediaMetadata.description: Metadata about image media. This will only be present for image types, and its contents will depend on what can be parsed from the image content.

aperture.description: The aperture used to create the photo (f-number).

cameraMake.description: The make of the camera used to create the photo.

cameraModel.description: The model of the camera used to create the photo.

colorSpace.description: The color space of the photo.

date.description: The date and time the photo was taken (EXIF format timestamp).

exposureBias.description: The exposure bias of the photo (APEX value).

exposureMode.description: The exposure mode used to create the photo.

exposureTime.description: The length of the exposure, in seconds.

flashUsed.description: Whether a flash was used to create the photo.

focalLength.description: The focal length used to create the photo, in millimeters.

height.description: The height of the image in pixels.

isoSpeed.description: The ISO speed used to create the photo.

lens.description: The lens used to create the photo.

location.description: Geographic location information stored in the image.

altitude.description: The altitude stored in the image.

latitude.description: The latitude stored in the image.

longitude.description: The longitude stored in the image.

maxApertureValue.description: The smallest f-number of the lens at the focal length used to create the photo (APEX value).

meteringMode.description: The metering mode used to create the photo.

rotation.description: The rotation in clockwise degrees from the image's original orientation.

sensor.description: The type of sensor used to create the photo.

subjectDistance.description: The distance to the subject of the photo, in meters.

whiteBalance.description: The white balance mode used to create the photo.

width.description: The width of the image in pixels.

indexableText.description: Indexable text attributes for the file (can only be written)

text.description: The text to be indexed for this file.

isAppAuthorized.description: Whether the file was created or opened by the requesting app.

isCompressed.description: Whether lossy compression has been applied to the original file contents.

kind.description: The type of file. This is always drive#file.

labels.description: A group of labels for the file.

modified.description: Whether the file has been modified by this user.

starred.description: Whether this file is starred by the user.

trashed.description: Whether this file has been trashed. This label applies to all users accessing the file; however, only owners are allowed to see and untrash files.

viewed.description: Whether this file has been viewed by this user.

lastModifyingUser.description: The last user to modify this file.

lastModifyingUserName.description: Name of the last user to modify this file.

lastViewedByMeDate.description: Last time this file was viewed by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

localId.description: The local ID used when creating this file.

md5Checksum.description: An MD5 checksum for the content of this file. This field is only populated for files with content stored in Google Drive; it is not populated for Google Docs or shortcut files.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the file. This is only mutable on update when uploading new content. This field can be left blank, and the mimetype will be determined from the uploaded content's MIME type.

modifiedByMeDate.description: Last time this file was modified by the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Note that setting modifiedDate will also update the modifiedByMe date for the user which set the date.

modifiedDate.description: Last time this file was modified by anyone (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). This is only mutable on update when the setModifiedDate parameter is set.

openWithLinks.description: A map of the id of each of the user's apps to a link to open this file with that app. Only populated when the drive.apps[.readonly] scope is used.

organizationDisplayName.description: The displayable name of the organization to which this file belongs.

originalFileSize.description: The size in bytes of the original file contents before lossy compression was applied. Only populated if the file contents are not identical to the original file contents.

originalFilename.description: The original filename of the uploaded content if available, or else the original value of the title field. This is only available for files with binary content in Google Drive.

originalMd5Checksum.description: The MD5 checksum (as a hex-encoded string) of the original file contents before lossy compression was applied. Only populated if the file contents are not identical to the original file contents.

ownedByMe.description: Whether the file is owned by the current user. Not populated for shared drive files.

ownerNames.description: Name(s) of the owner(s) of this file. Not populated for shared drive files.

owners.description: The owner(s) of this file. Not populated for shared drive files.

packageFileSize.description: The total size of the package in which this file is embedded. Only present when the file is embedded within a package. Applications must be whitelisted to read this field.

packageId.description: The package ID of the file, which is the same as the ID of the root file of this package. Only present if the file is embedded in a package. Applications must be whitelisted to read this field.

pairedDocType.description:
The type of the ShadowDoc (go/shadowdocsdd) associated with the file. Possible values are:  
- docs 
- sheets 
- slides

parents.description:
Collection of parent folders which contain this file.
If not specified as part of an insert request, the file will be placed directly in the user's My Drive folder. If not specified as part of a copy request, the file will inherit any discoverable parents of the source file. Update requests can also use the addParents and removeParents parameters to modify the parents list.

passivelySubscribed.description: Whether the current user is passively subscribed to this item.

permissionIds.description: List of permission IDs for users with access to this file.

permissions.description: The list of permissions for users with access to this file. Not populated for shared drive files.

permissionsSummary.description: A summary of the permissions on this file. This is an output-only field.

entryCount.description: Total number of permission entries. This includes entries not in "selectPermissions".

selectPermissions.description: A selection of at most 10 entries from permissions on this file.

visibility.description: Visibility of the document (e.g. link shared to anyone, domain shared).

additionalRoles.description: Additional roles for this user. Only commenter is currently possible.

domain.description: The domain of the entity the permission refers to. This is present when the visibility type is domain.

domainDisplayName.description: The domain name of the entity the permission refers to. This is present when the visibility type is domain.

permissionId.description: The ID of the permission that corresponds to this visibility.

role.description:
The primary role for this user. While new values may be supported in the future, the following are currently possible:  
- reader 
- writer

type.description:
The type of the visibility. Possible values are:  
- domain 
- anyone

withLink.description: Whether the link is required for the permission.

photosCompressionStatus.description: For image and video files, the status of the lossy compression.

photosStoragePolicy.description: For image and video files, the storage policy for the file.

preview.description: Resource to use for go/senna previews.

expiryDate.description: The time at which preview link expires (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

primaryDomainName.description: The DNS domain name of the primary domain of the organization to which this file belongs.

primarySyncParentId.description: The parent folder of the document that is also root or a subfolder of root. Note that this field is not completely reliable as there can be propagation delays. Not populated for shared drive files.

publishingInfo.description: Publish information related to a view.

published.description: Whether the file has been published.

publishedUrl.description: The URL for the published view of the file.

quotaBytesUsed.description: The number of quota bytes used by this file.

readersCanSeeComments.description: Whether a reader can see comments on the file.

recency.description: An RFC 3339 timestamp which is used as the sorting field for the sort order of the same name.

recencyReason.description:
The reason for the current recency. Possible values are:  
- createdByMe 
- modifiedByMe 
- modified 
- viewedByMe

recursiveFileCount.description: Recursive number of sub-items for this folder. Zero for non-folders and empty folders.

recursiveFileSize.description: File size in bytes for this file and all sub-items.

recursiveQuotaBytesUsed.description: The number of bytes charged to the requesting user's quota for this file and all sub-items.

selfLink.description: A link back to this file.

serverCreatedDate.description: The time at which this file was created from the perspective of the server (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

sha1Checksums.description: The SHA1 checksums associated with this file. Cosmo doesn't store SHA1 for files, so this is only populated for files returned from a query using the sha1 query term. Photos and videos that are compressed will have both an original and a high quality checksum. Original quality photos and videos will only have one checksum.

shareLink.description: A link to the sharing UI for this file.

shared.description: Whether the file has been shared. Not populated for shared drive files.

sharedWithMeDate.description: Time at which this file was shared with the user (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

sharingUser.description: User that shared the item with the current user, if available.

shortcutDetails.description: Shortcut file details. Only populated for shortcut files, which have the mimeType field set to application/vnd.google-apps.shortcut.

targetFile.description: The file that the shortcut points to. The nested file resource will be populated with the same fields requested for the shortcut resource. The field will be absent if the target cannot be retrieved because it has been deleted or is inaccessible to the requester. The targetLookupStatus field will indicate the status of the target lookup. Note that a shortcut is not allowed to point to another shortcut, so this field can only return a single nested target file.

targetId.description: The ID of the file that this shortcut points to.

targetLookupStatus.description:
The status of the shortcut target lookup operation, as a canonical code. The values expected here are:  
- ok</code 
- notFound 
- permissionDenied

targetMimeType.description: The MIME type of the file that this shortcut points to. The value of this field is a snapshot and is only populated when a shortcut is created.

shortcutTargetId.description: Deprecated: This field is being moved into shortcutDetails, however it's still read during creation.

shortcutTargetMimeType.description: Deprecated: This field is being moved into shortcutDetails.

source.description: The client that created an item. Deprecated: use driveSource

client_service_id.description: The unique identifier for the client, limited to the values in DriveSource.ClientService

value.description: An optional value carrying extra information about the client.

sourceAppId.description: The ID of the application that was used to create this file. This may be a superset of creatorAppId, but for the Drive Sources work, we weren't interested in merging the two fields.

sources.description: Field not implemented, subject to change.

spaces.description: The list of spaces which contain the file. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder', 'photos' and 'androidBackup'.

storagePolicyPending.description: Compression is underway or being attempted and the final "isCompressed" state is TBD.

subscribed.description: Whether the current user is subscribed to this item.

supportedRoles.description:
A list of roles supported by this file type. Possible values are:  
- owner 
- organizer 
- fileOrganizer 
- writer 
- commenter 
- reader 
- published_reader

templateData.description: Template Data attached to a Google document. This data is present if document is a template.

category.description: Categories for template. For domain templates, this is a list of strings each of which represent one category available for the domain.

galleryState.description: Gallery state for template which decides whether the template should be shown in the templates gallery or not. This can be one of: 1. AVAILABLE 2. UNAVAILABLE.

thumbnail.description: A thumbnail for the file. This will only be used if a standard thumbnail cannot be generated.

image.description: The URL-safe Base64 encoded bytes of the thumbnail image. It should conform to RFC 4648 section 5.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the thumbnail.

thumbnailLink.description: A short-lived link to the file's thumbnail. Typically lasts on the order of hours. Only populated when the requesting app can access the file's content.

thumbnailVersion.description: The thumbnail version for use in thumbnail cache invalidation.

title.description: The title of this file. Note that for immutable items such as the top level folders of shared drives, My Drive root folder, and Application Data folder the title is constant.

trashedDate.description: The time that the item was trashed (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp). Only populated for shared drive files.

trashingUser.description: If the file has been explicitly trashed, the user who trashed it. Only populated for shared drive files.

userPermission.description: The permissions for the authenticated user on this file. Includes a subset of the associated permissions resource. The "role" field is always populated. The partial resource uses an ID of "me" that differs from the full resource.

version.description: A monotonically increasing version number for the file. This reflects every change made to the file on the server, even those not visible to the requesting user.

videoMediaMetadata.description: Metadata about video media. This will only be present for video types.

durationMillis.description: The duration of the video in milliseconds.

height.description: The height of the video in pixels.

width.description: The width of the video in pixels.

warningDetectors.description: A list of DLP detector names for the file with warning consequences.

webContentLink.description: A link for downloading the content of the file in a browser using cookie based authentication. In cases where the content is shared publicly, the content can be downloaded without any credentials.

webViewLink.description: A link only available on public folders for viewing their static web assets (HTML, CSS, JS, etc) via Google Drive's Website Hosting.

workspaceIds.description: IDs of Workspaces to which the file belongs.

writersCanShare.description: Whether writers can share the document with other users. Not populated for shared drive files.

incompleteSearch.description: Whether the search process was incomplete. If true, then some search results may be missing, since all documents were not searched. This may occur when searching multiple drives with the "allDrives" corpora, but all corpora could not be searched. When this happens, it is suggested that clients narrow their query by choosing a different corpus such as "default" or "drive".

items.description: The list of files. If nextPageToken is populated, then this list may be incomplete and an additional page of results should be fetched.

nextLink.description: A link to the next page of files.

nextPageToken.description: The page token for the next page of files. This will be absent if the end of the files list has been reached. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and pagination should be restarted from the first page of results.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

spellResponse.description: Spell response data. An example of this would be a correction in the spelling of a query that will likely return more results.

suggestedNlpQueries.description: List of suggested alternate "q" parameter values to use. These alternates are determined by applying natural language processing to the user's input to turn an unstructured query into a structured query.

space.description: The type of the file this local ID represents.

value.description: A per-app-user identifier when combined with space and version.

version.description: The version of the conversion protocol used to generate the ID from the file ID.

FilePreview.description: A preview of the contents of a file.

archivePreview.description: The list of contents of an archive file.

etag.description: The ETag of the file preview.

selfLink.description: A link back to this file preview.

fileIds.description: List of IDs of files whose permissions should be fixed with the specified fix option type.

fixOptionType.description: The type of fix to execute for the specified files.

recipientEmailAddresses.description: List of email address to add to the permissions of the specified files if the 'ADD_COLLABORATORS' fix option type is specified.

role.description: Role that should be applied to the files' collaborators (if 'ADD_COLLABORATORS' fix option type is specified) or to users accessing the files via a visible file link (for visibility-related fix option types).

GeneratedIds.description: A list of generated IDs which can be provided in insert requests

ids.description: The IDs generated for the requesting user in the specified space.

space.description: The space in which items can be created with these IDs.

type.description: The type of items which can be created with these IDs.

MigrateToDrivePreFlightRequest.description: Verifies if migrating a set of files & folders into a shared drive can succeed without errors. The result is a best effort check on a potential migration.

continuationToken.description: A token to continue processing a pre-flight request. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and the pre-flight request should be restarted without providing a token.

destinationFolderId.description: ID of the destination folder. Must be in a shared drive.

sourceIds.description: A set of IDs of files or folders to obtain pre-flight information for.

MigrateToDrivePreFlightResponse.description: Verifies if migrating a set of files & folders into a shared drive can succeed without errors. The result is a best effort check on a potential migration.

continuationToken.description: A continuation token present when additional results can be processed.

MigrateToTeamDrivePreFlightRequest.description: Verifies if migrating a set of files & folders into a Team Drive can succeed without errors. The result is a best effort check on a potential migration.

continuationToken.description: A token to continue processing a pre-flight request. If the token is rejected for any reason, it should be discarded, and the pre-flight request should be restarted without providing a token.

destinationFolderId.description: ID of the destination folder. Must be in a Team Drive.

sourceIds.description: A set of IDs of files or folders to obtain pre-flight information for.

MigrateToTeamDrivePreFlightResponse.description: Verifies if migrating a set of files & folders into a Team Drive can succeed without errors. The result is a best effort check on a potential migration.

continuationToken.description: A continuation token present when additional results can be processed.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code defined in ISO 4217.

explanationCode.description: Deprecated: Clients should not depend on this field being present. The explanation code of why this document was predicted. This field is more intended for logging and analysis, rather than for direct display to the user.

explanationMessage.description: The localized (using the provided locale) explanation message for why this document was predicted. The intention is that this message may be shown to the user.

file.description: The file resource for the document that was predicted.

predictionSources.description: Deprecated: Clients should not depend on this field being present. The sources of the prediction.

score.description: The score of this prediction for the target.

NextDocPredictionList.description: A list of predictions for a user

experimentIds.description: Deprecated: Clients should not depend on this field being present. The experiment IDs associated with the prediction.

selfLink.description: A link back to this list.

tag.description: A tag for the purpose of logging and analysis.

accessRequestData.description: Additional content for Access Request notifications.

fileId.description: ID of the item in Drive.

granteeUser.description: User that will receive access. This may be different from the requester, who could be requesting access on behalf of the grantee.

requestedRole.description:
The requested new level of access. Possible values are:  
- reader 
- commenter 
- writer 
- owner 
- organizer

requesterUser.description: User who made the access request.

shareUrl.description: Link to open the item's sharing dialog in Drive.

commentCount.description: The number of comments that are batched in this notification.

commentDetails.description: Details about each comment in the thread.

assigneeUser.description: The assignee of a todo. Only set if the commentType is "todo".

commentQuote.description: The quoted text that the comment references. Only set if the comment quotes text.

commentType.description:
The type of the comment. Possible values are:  
- comment 
- suggestion 
- todo

isRecipientAssignee.description: Whether the recipient is also the todo assignee.

isRecipientMentioned.description: Whether the recipient of the notification was @mentioned in the comment.

commentUrl.description: Link to the comment in Drive.

commenters.description: The list of users that made comments in this notification.

fileId.description: ID of the item in Drive that is being commented on.

createdDate.description: Create time for this notification (formatted RFC 3339 timestamp).

notificationType.description:
The type of this notification. Possible values are:  
- share 
- accessRequest 
- storageAlert 
- comment

driveItems.description: Drive IDs of all shared items.

alternateLink.description: Link to open the shared item in Drive.

fileId.description: ID of the shared item in Drive.
Deprecated.

senderUser.description: User who shared the Drive items.
